definitions.definition: a man who has people working for him, often as servants in his home

examples.text: They lived in fear of their master.
Their relationship was one of master and servant.
The visitor asked to see the master of the house.
Their survival depended on obeying their master.
corrupt people who would serve any master

definitions.definition: a person who is in charge of an organization or group

examples.text: The police had to obey their political masters.
The city's new masters patrol deserted streets.
those titans of industry, the masters of the universe

definitions.definition: a person who is able to control something

examples.text: She was no longer master of her own future.
Fate can be a cruel master.
We remain masters of our fate.

definitions.definition: a person who shows a lot of skill at something
definitions.sensetop: master of somethingmaster at doing something

examples.text: a master of disguise
a master of her craft
a master of the serve-and-volley game
a master at managing money
Chaplin, the grand master of physical comedy
Like most masters of her craft, Bowery wasn't appreciated in her time.
The fugue was out of fashion when Bach became its master.

phrases: be a past master at something
be a past master of something

definitions.definition: a famous painter who lived in the past

examples.text: an exhibition of work by the French master, Monet
the great masters of Impressionism
This portrait is the work of an acknowledged master.

definitions.definition: a second university degree, or, in Scotland, a first university degree, such as an MA

examples.text: He has a Master's in Business Administration.
She holds a master's degree in journalism.
He did a Master's at Hull University.
She got her Master's last year.

definitions.definition: a person who has a master’s degree

examples.text: a **Master of Arts/Science**

definitions.definition: the owner of an animal, especially a dog or horse

examples.text: The dog saved its master's life.
Even the animals knew their masters were excited.
The horses watched their masters placidly.

definitions.definition: a male teacher at a school, especially a private school

examples.text: the physics master
He was ballet master at several dance schools.

definitions.definition: the captain of a ship that transports goods
a version of a recording from which copies are made

examples.text: the **master copy**

definitions.definition: a title used when speaking to or about a boy who is too young to be called Mr (also used in front of the name on an envelope, etc.)
(in the UK) the title of the head of some schools and university colleges

examples.text: the Master of Wolfson College

definitions.definition: a title used for speaking to or about some religious teachers or leaders
to be free to make your own decisions rather than being told what to do by somebody else
to support two different parties, principles, etc. at the same time

wordOrigin: Old English mæg(i)ster (later reinforced by Old French maistre), from Latin magister; probably related to magis ‘more’.
